programme.title: 2025 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony
programme.desc: Recorded live from the Peacock Theater in Los Angeles, this year's ceremony features rare once-in-a-lifetime performances and moments celebrating the legacy and influence of this year's inductees: Bad Company, Chubby Checker, Joe Cocker, Cyndi Lauper, Outkast, Soundgarden and The White Stripes in the Performer category, along with Salt-N-Pepa and Warren Zevon for Musical Influence, Thom Bell, Nicky Hopkins and Carol Kaye for Musical Excellence, and Lenny Waronker for the Ahmet Ertegun Award.

programme.title: ABCNL Prime With Linsey Davis
programme.desc: Providing prime-time context and analysis of the day's top stories, as well as in-depth reporting and storytelling from around the country and the globe.

programme.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live!
programme.desc: Emmy-winning funnyman Jimmy Kimmel serves up comedy bits and welcomes guests that include other comics, celebrities, athletes and musicians, as well as everyday people with unusual or compelling personal stories. Kimmel's family and friends take part in the festivities, including his Cousin Sal, Uncle Frank (until his death in 2011) and childhood friend Cleto Escobedo III, who leads the show's house band. Recurring segments include the FCC-pleasing This Week in Unnecessary Censorship in which they take TV clips and "bleep and blur things whether they need it or not," as Kimmel describes it. But it's too bad they consistently run out of time for Matt Damon's segment.

programme.title: Live: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Late Night With Seth Meyers
programme.desc: With his signature monologue and sharp newsy segments like "A Closer Look," Seth Meyers hilariously breaks down the day's biggest stories and takes the current political circus head-on. He then welcomes Hollywood's most beloved A-list guests, as well as people not seen anywhere else in late night, like political figures and other interesting newsmakers. With fan-favorite comedy segments that become viral sensations, and the talented 8G band at his side, Seth consistently brings home the last laugh.

programme.title: 1st Look
programme.desc: Each episode of this travel series sees the host becoming immersed with locals to experience unique culture, authentic cuisine and amazing conversations that turn every city into an unforgettable memory, and brings the world to the viewer through the exploration of inspiring and exciting destinations across the globe. Whether it's rediscovering a familiar road or taking the path less traveled, there is magic to be found around every corner. Every adventure starts with a "1st Look.".

programme.desc: Each episode of this travel series sees the host becoming immersed with locals to experience unique culture, authentic cuisine and amazing conversations that turn every city into an unforgettable memory, and brings the world to the viewer through the exploration of inspiring and exciting destinations across the globe. Whether it's rediscovering a familiar road or taking the path less traveled, there is magic to be found around every corner. Every adventure starts with a "1st Look.".

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A bulldog investment fund manager is murdered in the midst of a client's big takeover; Price goes to desperate lengths to prove the suspect's motive.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Bruno suspects a bomb was planted to destroy DNA evidence in a rape case; Benson takes on a murder investigation connected to the bombing; Griffin experiences the frustrating setbacks of working an SVU case.

programme.title: The Hunting Party
programme.desc: Bex and the team track the brilliant and beguiling Jenna Wells, the notorious Killer Chemist whose therapy in the Pit has made her even more dangerous and deranged.

programme.title: Top Stories of 2025
programme.desc: Tom Llamas counts down the top stories, people, and trends that defined 2025, including President Trump's tariffs, the assassination of Charlie Kirk and the election of Pope Leo XIV.

programme.title: Early Today
programme.desc: This early-morning news covers overnight events, breaking domestic and international news as well as a preview of the day's anticipated events. The program also presents regular reports from the worlds of business, entertainment and sports.

programme.desc: American communities kick off celebrations for the nation's 250th birthday; real estate with Christine Romans; keeping resolutions with Daniel Pink; USA hockey team reveal; author Harlan Coben; best places to travel in 2026 with Megan Spurrell.

programme.desc: Exploring Tulsa; Craig learns to be the Sunday Night Football timeout coordinator; Anne Frank The Exhibition; former teacher builds real life "Magic School Bus"; parallel parking championships.

programme.title: Happy's Place
programme.desc: After Bobbie and Emmett's big moment, Bobbie is still unsure how Emmett truly feels about her, prompting Bobbie to do the unthinkable and give Emmett a birthday gift; Gabby tries to convince Isabella to give her the family discount on Happy's house.

programme.title: Stumble
programme.desc: As Courteney gets the team competition ready, she tries to find an assistant she can trust to lighten her load and help her elevate the team to the next level; in the process, she makes the discovery about who leaked the tape that got her fired.

programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: When deadly gunfire erupts in an Austin, Texas, home in the middle of the night, detectives wonder if the homeowners' jewelry business is a possible motive; an investigation uncovers a suspect that no one saw coming.

programme.title: Forever Young With Dr. Pablo Prichard
programme.desc: Danielle Robb and Dr. Pablo Prichard introduce the Wheel of Age - a groundbreaking tool that reveals why and how fast a body is really aging; guest Sabrina Soto undergoes cutting-edge tests that uncover the hidden ages of her brain, heart and more.

programme.title: Mutual of Omaha's Wild Kingdom Protecting the Wild
programme.desc: Habitat destruction and more factors have decimated the Canada lynx in the Pacific Northwest; Peter and Dr. Rae assist a native tribe and a dedicated team of wildlife biologists with an innovative program to reintroduce them back to American forests.

programme.title: Earth Odyssey With Dylan Dreyer
programme.desc: Dylan Dreyer travels to the Iberian Peninsula, where a lynx is on the prowl, a fox goes up against an eagle and wild bunnies are making a comeback.

programme.title: Wild Child
programme.desc: Sheinelle Jones explores how baby animals from camels to coyotes cope with their sizzling hot habitats.

programme.title: Live: Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: From Vitality Stadium in Bournemouth, England, United Kingdom.

programme.title: Live: Premier League Goal Zone
programme.desc: The best moments from the weekend in Premier League action.

programme.title: Live: U.S. Olympic Trials
programme.desc: Men's & Women's 1000m.

programme.title: Open House
programme.desc: Buying a house can be a stressful, time-consuming process, which is why people turn to shows such as "Open House" to get help in the real estate market. Hosts Sara Gore and George Oliphant (who also rescues homeowners' renovation projects on sister show "George to the Rescue," which began as a segment of "Open House" before becoming a stand-alone show) showcase some of the hottest homes on the market in major cities, get interior design tips from experts and provide information on what people need to know about stylish living.

programme.title: The Paper
programme.desc: Mare uncovers a story that pits the Truth Teller against its corporate owner; Ned's past as a high-pressure toilet paper salesman embarrasses him; Esmeralda tries to stage-mom her son into commercials; Ken participates in a cover-up.

programme.title: The Paper
programme.desc: Ned and Mare take a long road trip to interview a possible cult leader after Detrick backs out; Ken drags Nicole into his corporate apology tour; Oscar is driven mad by a troll commenting on his pieces; Esmeralda is visited by an incubus.

programme.title: The Paper
programme.desc: Ned stifles his desire to win at the Ohio Journalism Awards; Nicole uncovers Detrick's monogamy and becomes furious; Oscar comes to terms with the documentary; Mare brings a famous date; Esmeralda sings and Ken plots an emergency to play the hero.

programme.title: St. Denis Medical
programme.sub-title: I Left a Woman on the Table
programme.desc: Matt struggles to deal with a patient from his past; Bruce tries to rekindle romance with a former flame; Joyce treats patients to cover a nursing shortage.

programme.desc: From Nov. 11, 2023: Host Timothée Chalamet; boygenius performs.
